top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Bogotá rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel Bogotá’s colombian mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Gravel Bogotá’s colombian mountains, south american gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Bogotá when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Gravel Bogotá isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Bogotá. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 80 miles, Gravel Bogotá punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Gravel Bogotá intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Gravel Bogotá’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Bogotá — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Gravel Bogotá — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Bogotá — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on colombian mountain gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel Bogotá’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Gravel Bogotá with 8,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Bogotá requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colombian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: colombian mountains, south american gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, VO2max, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 80 miles of colombian mountain gravel in Bogotá, Colombia.
